footnotes: [1] i.e., those horses that fight for the cause of Allah as they race to attack the enemy.

translation: striking sparks of fire [with their hooves][2],

footnotes: [3] While the enemy is unaware of their raid.

translation: stirring up thereby clouds of dust,
plunging thereby into the midst of the enemy[4],
footnotes: [4] i.e., penetrating into the ranks of the enemy as a surprise attack.

translation: indeed, man is very ungrateful to his Lord[5] –
footnotes: [5] disobeying Him by not spending in the cause of Allah from what He has given him and commanded him to spend accordingly.

translation: and he himself is a witness to that[6] –
and he is truly extreme in his love of wealth.

arabic_text: ۞ أَفَلَا يَعۡلَمُ إِذَا بُعۡثِرَ مَا فِي ٱلۡقُبُورِ
translation: Does he not know that when the contents of graves will be overturned,
and the secrets of the hearts will be brought to light[7]?
footnotes: [7] i.e., when all secrets of the hearts and faiths are made known.

translation: Indeed, their Lord is All-Aware of them on that Day[8].
footnotes: [8] Nothing of their affairs will be hidden from Him.
